[[Image:J.R.R. Tolkien - Ae Adar Nin.png: '''Ae Adar Nín''' ("Pater noster" in [[Sindarin]]) is [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s Sindarin translation of most of the [[Lord's Prayer (disambiguation)
thumb: Lord's Prayer]]. He left the last two lines untranslated, but his notes show that he intended to use ''[[úthaes]]'' as the word for "temptation" (cognate with [[Quenya
Tolkien's notes on ''Ae Adar Nín'']]: Q.]] ''úsahtië''). The poem can be read in [[Vinyar Tengwar 44
column4: ''Vinyar Tengwar'', no. 44]] on pages 21-30, edited by [[Bill Welden]].

[[Image:J.R.R. Tolkien - Ae Adar Nin.png: Tolkien's notes on the poem, written on the back of a postcard, are reproduced on the cover of [[Tolkien Studies: Volume 4
* [http://www.elvish.org/gwaith/andries/andries_adarnin.jpg Image of the poem in calligraphy]
